accessibility_orgs.name: Abilities Ottawa

accessibility_orgs.name: Ability First Ottawa
accessibility_orgs.description: Comprehensive services and support for people with disabilities.

accessibility_orgs.name: ABLE2
accessibility_orgs.description: Empowers individuals of all ages across the disability spectrum to lead fulfilling lives by supporting them with programs, services, and resources.

accessibility_orgs.name: Active Abilities Canada
accessibility_orgs.description: Bringing physical activity, recreation, and sport professionals together to ensure participation for people of all abilities.

accessibility_orgs.name: Breaking925
accessibility_orgs.description: Dismantles systemic employment barriers faced by mid-senior career level professionals due to disabilities.

accessibility_orgs.name: Canadian Council of the Blind
accessibility_orgs.description: Vibrant network of active members across Canada. Each chapter is unique to its geographic area and engages in a variety of social and recreational activities based on the particular interests of their local members.

accessibility_orgs.name: Canadian Hard of Hearing Association
accessibility_orgs.description: Creating accessible, connected, and equitable communities for Canadians with hearing loss.

accessibility_orgs.name: Disability Advocacy Network of Eastern Ontario
accessibility_orgs.description: Advocates for the rights of citizens labelled with an intellectual/developmental disability to have access to the same opportunities and choices as other Ontarians.

accessibility_orgs.name: Kids on the Block Ottawa
accessibility_orgs.description: Disability awareness, bullying prevention, and educational puppet performance.

accessibility_orgs.name: Neil Squire Society
accessibility_orgs.description: Uses technology, knowledge, and passion to empower Canadians with disabilities.

accessibility_orgs.name: Ottawa Independent Living Resource Centre
accessibility_orgs.description: Promoting a new perspective on disability.

accessibility_orgs.name: Pinecrest-Queensway Community Health Centre (PQCHC) Blind-Low Vision Early Intervention Program
accessibility_orgs.description: Builds your knowledge about your child's learning style and builds your capacity to respond to their developmental needs.

food_orgs.name: The Baby Cupboard Program
food_orgs.description: Distributes items such as diapers, wipes, cereals, and other baby items to families with children ages 0 to 3 years old with postal codes K1K, K1M, and, in some cases, K1G.

food_orgs.name: Blair Court Community House
food_orgs.description: Offers food by appointment.

food_orgs.name: Bountiful Beaver
food_orgs.description: A queer communal gardening project.

food_orgs.name: Community Compassion Centre Food Bank
food_orgs.description: Provides food and assistance to our K1C neighbours.

food_orgs.name: Confederation Court Community House Food Bank
food_orgs.description: Provides essential support to individuals and families facing food insecurity.

food_orgs.name: Dalhousie Food Cupboard
food_orgs.description: Meets the needs of our neighbours by providing emergency food support and offering innovative solutions to address food security, build community, and promote well-being.

food_orgs.name: Feed the City
food_orgs.description: Delivers emergency food to community members in Ottawa, Ontario, who are unable to access their local food bank, due to a variety of barriers.

food_orgs.name: Foodeliver
food_orgs.description: Shares kindness through making food accessible to newcomer families with dignity. Reduces food waste, improves access to nutritious meals, and builds a more caring community in Ottawa.

food_orgs.name: Foodsharing Ottawa
food_orgs.description: Working together to reduce food waste in our community.

food_orgs.name: Gloucester Emergency Food Cupboard
food_orgs.description: Alleviates food insecurity in our community by working together to create opportunities to access and share good food through innovative food programming, partnerships, and civic engagement.

food_orgs.name: In From the Cold
food_orgs.description: Cooks and serves a delicious 4-course meal, hosts live music from local bands, and gets the community together.

food_orgs.name: Just Food
food_orgs.description: Building a sustainable food system that ensures access to healthy, local food for all Ottawa residents.

food_orgs.name: Orléans-Cumberland Community Resource Centre Food Bank
food_orgs.description: Offers emergency food to low-income individuals and families within the Orleans East, Cumberland, Sarsfield, Vars, Navan, and Carlsbad Spring communities.

food_orgs.name: Ottawa Community Food Partnership
food_orgs.description: Shifting the way we think about the food charity model across Algonquin/Ottawa towards meaningful community engagement and food security.

food_orgs.name: Ottawa Food Bank
food_orgs.description: Creates a healthier city by empowering people, increasing access to healthy food, and advocating for systemic changes that reduce food insecurity.

food_orgs.name: Ottawa Food Rescue
food_orgs.description: Works with donors, volunteers, and charities to ensure those in our community that may need a helping hand have access to quality food.

food_orgs.name: Ottawa Mission Food Truck
food_orgs.description: Travels to our city's most vulnerable communities to serve people in need.

food_orgs.name: Parkdale Food Centre
food_orgs.description: Builds healthier, more connected neighbourhoods through good food, innovative community partnerships, and by challenging inequalities in order to create lasting impacts.

food_orgs.name: Partage Vanier
food_orgs.description: Offre du dépannage alimentaire d'urgence une fois par mois pour les résident.es de Vanier.

food_orgs.name: Pavilion Food Bank
food_orgs.description: Provides food for three days, once a month.

food_orgs.name: Pinecrest-Queensway Community Health Centre (PQCHC) Food Bank
food_orgs.description: Provides access to nutritious and nourishing food, which positively impacts health and well-being.

food_orgs.name: Rideau-Rockcliffe Community Resource Centre Emergency Food Bank
food_orgs.description: Aims to reduce food insecurity.

food_orgs.name: Russell Heights Community House Food Bank
food_orgs.description: Improves the quality of life for our community members.

food_orgs.name: St. Joe's Supper Table
food_orgs.description: Feeds the hungry that come to their doors. Serves anyone who comes in need of food - for both the body and the soul.

food_orgs.name: UOSU Food Bank
food_orgs.description: Supports undergraduate students at the University of Ottawa who are experiencing food insecurity.

food_orgs.name: Westboro Region Food Bank
food_orgs.description: Provides fresh and non-perishable food and essential supplies to food bank neighbours.

homelessness_orgs.name: Action Housing
homelessness_orgs.description: Assists clients to find housing when they do not have computer access or the skills to look online for themselves.

homelessness_orgs.name: Alliance to End Homelessness Ottawa
homelessness_orgs.description: Member-driven coalition of people and organisations working together to end homelessness through systems planning and coordination, public education and advocacy, and community-wide mobilization.

homelessness_orgs.name: Ancoura
homelessness_orgs.description: Provides a nurturing and fulfilling environment for adults living with a mental illness in Ottawa through stable housing and a supportive community.

homelessness_orgs.name: Backpacks for the Homeless
homelessness_orgs.description: Gives backpacks to the homeless.

homelessness_orgs.name: Centre 454
homelessness_orgs.description: Provides laundry, showers, hygiene supplies, telephone access, Wifi access, and community navigation support to people looking for community and connection. Hosts social activities, including bingo, karaoke, and arts and crafts.

homelessness_orgs.name: Chrysalis House
homelessness_orgs.description: Provides shelter to cis and trans women, two-spirit, non-binary, and gender-diverse people of diverse ages, cultures, race, sexual orientaions, and abilities.

homelessness_orgs.name: Cornerstone
homelessness_orgs.description: Helps women transform their lives from crisis to hope, housing, and healing.

homelessness_orgs.name: GottaGo!
homelessness_orgs.description: Campaigns for a network of public toilets in Ottawa.

homelessness_orgs.name: Landseed
homelessness_orgs.description: Addresses the Canadian housing crisis by leveraging community market data and AI systems to solution the problems and support attainable housing opportunities for corhorts in need.

homelessness_orgs.name: Naomi's House
homelessness_orgs.description: Protects women with or without children who have been physically, emotionally, sexually, or financially threatened or harassed.

homelessness_orgs.name: Operation Come Home
homelessness_orgs.description: A centre for homeless and at-risk youth aged 16-29, dedicated to providing employment, education, and support services.

homelessness_orgs.name: Ottawa Community Housing
homelessness_orgs.description: Delivers a great housing experience through exceptional service. Works closely with communities to foster tenants' sense of belonging and empowerment. Provides quality, safe, and affordable homes meeting the needs of individuals and families. Works with partners to support the tenants' needs and contribute to stronger, more inclusive communities.

homelessness_orgs.name: Ottawa Innercity Ministries
homelessness_orgs.description: Comes alongside and supports individuals experiencing poverty and homelessness, by demonstrating the message of Christ in action and word, showing compassion, and promoting self-esteem.

homelessness_orgs.name: The Ottawa Mission
homelessness_orgs.description: Helps people experiencing poverty, addiction, and homelessness to change their lives.

homelessness_orgs.name: Pal Ottawa
homelessness_orgs.description: Works to meet the needs of senior artists and arts workers in the National Capital Region by providing access to affordable housing, personal support services, and community programming.

homelessness_orgs.name: Salus Ottawa
homelessness_orgs.description: Creates opportunities for adults with mental health and substance use health challenges, as well as behavioural addictions, to live independently by improving access to housing and a community of integrated support services.

homelessness_orgs.name: Shepherds of Good Hope
homelessness_orgs.description: Shelter. Stability. Support. Dignity. Community. Employment. Helps people find their way to hope - in all its forms.

homelessness_orgs.name: St. Joe's Women's Centre
homelessness_orgs.description: Provides a safe, welcoming space with social and educational programs that empower, promote autonomy, and uphold dignity within a non-judgmental atmosphere for all women and their children.

homelessness_orgs.name: St. Luke's Table
homelessness_orgs.description: Provides coffee, tea, breakfast, lunch, hygiene supplies, telephone access, Wifi and computer access, and community navigation support in the heart of the Chinatown neighbourhood of Ottawa. Also hosts karaoke, bingo, movies, and more.

homelessness_orgs.name: The Well
homelessness_orgs.description: Provides laundry, showers, meals (breakfast and lunch), hygiene supplies, telephone access, internet, and community navigation support to women, children, and gender-diverse people.

homelessness_orgs.name: Youth Services Bureau of Ottawa (YSB) Housing and Shelter
homelessness_orgs.description: Offers multiple services and housing programs to suit youth in a variety of life situations.

indigenous_orgs.name: Hope for Wellness Helpline
indigenous_orgs.description: Provides experienced and culturally competent counsellors for all Indigenous people across Canada.

indigenous_orgs.name: Minwaashin Lodge
indigenous_orgs.description: Provides a range of programs and services to First Nations, Inuit, and Métis women and children (regardless of status) who are survivors of domestic and other forms of violence, and who may also be suffering the effects of the residential school system.

indigenous_orgs.name: Odawa Native Friendship Centre
indigenous_orgs.description: Enhances the quality of life for Indigenous people in the Capital Region.

indigenous_orgs.name: Ontario Native Women's Association: Services for Indigenous Women in Ottawa
indigenous_orgs.description: Provices programs and services for Indigenous women.

transit_orgs.name: Bike Ottawa
transit_orgs.description: Advocates for a vibrant and equitable Ottawa where active transportation plays an important role in year-round mobility.

transit_orgs.name: Envirocentre
transit_orgs.description: Hosts Let's Bike Month, an annual campaign that encourages people to try cycling as a fun and healthy transportation option.

transit_orgs.name: Free Transit Ottawa
transit_orgs.description: Shares a common goal of a more equitable and sustainable future for all. Sees public transit as having a crucial role in combating climate change and promoting social justice in Ottawa and around the world.

transit_orgs.name: Helping with Bikes
transit_orgs.description: Provides adults and children in client families with functional bikes as an affordable means of transportation and a source of exercise and safe, wholesome fun.

transit_orgs.name: Hop on Bikes
transit_orgs.description: Obtains, refurbishes, fits, and delivers bikes to children and youth living in Ottawa Community Housing communities.

transit_orgs.name: Ottawa Transit Riders
transit_orgs.description: Works to make Ottawa's transit system more affordable, reliable, accessible, and safe for users.

transit_orgs.name: re-Cycles
transit_orgs.description: Puts more bicycles on the road by providing affordable, recycled bikes to the community; provides low-cost access to a fully equipped bike repair shop; reduces materials going into landfills by recycling bikes and bike parts; promotes a healthier environment and lifestyle, and offers a place for like-minded bike enthusiasts to meet and exchange ideas.

transit_orgs.name: Recyclore
transit_orgs.description: Keeps bicycles out of the landfill and puts them back on the street. Accepts donations of old bicycles, reconditions them, and then offers the used bicycles for sale.

transit_orgs.name: Trips for Kids Ottawa
transit_orgs.description: Provides outdoor recreation to Ottawa's youth, who would not otherwise have the opportunity.

transit_orgs.name: UOSU Bike Co-op
transit_orgs.description: An inclusive DIY space for beginners as well as experts. Provides tools and expertise needed to repair or build a bicycle.

transit_orgs.name: Vélo Vanier
transit_orgs.description: Offers Vanier residents the opportunity to borrow a bicycle for free during the summer months.

newcomer_orgs.name: Catholic Centre for Immigrants Ottawa
newcomer_orgs.description: Promotes and facilitates the reception of newcomers to Canada, sensitizes the community to address newcomers' needs and invites it to respond, and assists newcomes to realize their full potential in Canadian Society.

newcomer_orgs.name: Centretown Community Health Centre LGBTQIA+ Newcomer Program
newcomer_orgs.description: A social drop-in for LGBTQIA+ newcomers.

newcomer_orgs.name: CÉSOC Refugee Resettlement Assistance Program (RAP)
newcomer_orgs.description: Welcomes, integrates, and resettles refugees sponsored by the federal government.

newcomer_orgs.name: CÉSOC Support for Elderly Immigrants
newcomer_orgs.description: Helps immigrant seniors age safely and with dignity in their own homes by providing them with culturally and linguistically appropriate services offered by volunteers, community relations workers, and case managers.

newcomer_orgs.name: Jewish Family Services (JFS) Settlement Services
newcomer_orgs.description: Offers newcomer services to all newcomers, no matter your cultural, ethnic, and linguistic backgrounds.

newcomer_orgs.name: Ottawa Community Immigrant Services Organization (OCISO)
newcomer_orgs.description: Supports immigrants through the journey of making Canada their home by providing creative and responsive programs that are culturally and linguistically appropriate, by building community through mutual respect and partnerships, and by fostering healthy and inclusive spaces for open dialogue and healing.

newcomer_orgs.name: Ottawa Newcomers' Club
newcomer_orgs.description: Helps women new to Ottawa or those who have experienced a significant life change in the last two years meet new friends and become part of the community.

newcomer_orgs.name: Ottawa Public Library
newcomer_orgs.description: Provides blogs, events, and online resources for newcomers.

newcomer_orgs.name: Pinecrest-Queensway Community Health Centre (PQCHC) Community Connections for Newcomer Employment
newcomer_orgs.description: Provides employment preparation help to newcomers and connects them with community resources and employment supports to be able to find a job.

newcomer_orgs.name: Positive Spaces Initiative
newcomer_orgs.description: Shares resources and increases organizational capacity across the immigrant- and refugee-serving sector to more effectively serve LGBTQIA+ immigrants, refugees, and newcomers.

newcomer_orgs.name: YMCA Newcomer Information Centre
newcomer_orgs.description: Provides newcomers with all the necessary resources and support to help them successfully integrate into their new community.

survivor_support_orgs.name: Algonquin College Student Distress Line
survivor_support_orgs.description: Connects survivors of a sexual assault to relevant support, resources, and options on campus.

survivor_support_orgs.name: Carlington Community Health Centre Health Services for Violence Against Women

survivor_support_orgs.name: Centre for Treatment of Sexual Abuse and Childhood Trauma
survivor_support_orgs.description: Offers individual, couples, and group therapy.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Capital Rainbow Refuge
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Supports and sponsors LGBTQI+ refugees.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Centretown Community Health Centre 2SLGBTQIA+ Programs and Services
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Provides free programs for counselling, HIV point-of-care testing, hormone therapy starts and surgery referral, LGBTQIA+ newcomers, and trans health.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Champlain Regional Planning Table (RPT) for Trans, Non-binary, Two-Spirit, Intersex, and Gender-Diverse Health

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: CHEO Gender Diversity Clinic
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Works with families to create individualized care plans that support each youth's gender affirmation goals.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Les Chouettes
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Organises social, cultural, and outdoor activities for women who love women.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: CUSA Gender & Sexuality Resource Centre (GSRC)
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Creates a safe(r) environment for the 2SLGBTQIA+ community through education, advocacy, and unwavering support.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Family Services Ottawa (FSO) 2SLGBTQI+ Around the Rainbow
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Provides education, counselling, and support services to 2SLGBTQI+ families and individuals.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: FrancoQueer
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Mobilise, soutient et célèbre les francophones 2SLGBTQIA+ en Ontario, tout en sensibilisant et en outillant les communautés et les organisations pour favoriser la création d'espaces sécuritaires, affirmatifs et respectueux de la diversité affective, sexuelle et de genre.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Gay Lesbian Tennis Ottawa
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: A social group in Ottawa and surrounding areas that values equality, respect, and having fun while playing tennis.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Gegi
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Helps you or someone you love advocate for your gender expression and gender identity human rights at school.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Gender Marker Change Guide
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Document check-lists, important tips, and additional information about the process of changing your gender marker on a variety of different documents.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Gender Mosaic
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Trans social and support group.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Goodhead
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Website for guys into guys (G2G) to learn and get curious about the mental health issues affecting them and their communities and to help them locate mental health services in Ontario.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: The Good Companions 2SLGBTQIA+ Programs and Services
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Offers programs for the senior Rainbow Community.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Government of Canada Gender-inclusive writing
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Vocabularies, glossaries, and collections of terms related to gender and sexual diversity.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: English and French equivalents to 155 concepts on gender and sexual diversity.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Government of Canada 2SLGBTQI+ terminology
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Glossary and common acronyms related to 2SLGBTQI+ identities and issues.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Kind Space
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Community centre that offers resources, events, social, and educational programming. Celebrates, supports, and prioritises oppressed sexual orientations, gender identities, and expressions.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Provides opportunities for lesbians, bisexual, trans, and LGBT-friendly women in the Ottawa-Gatineau region to enjoy the great outdoors and to socialise indoors, too!

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: MAX Ottawa
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Health and wellness services and programs for queer, trans, and non-binary people.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Resources for students, families, and staff of all gender identities, gender expressions, and sexual orientations to feel physically and emotionally safe, welcomed, and accepted at school.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Ottawa Frontrunners (OFR)
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: A running and walking club for members of the Two-Spirit, Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, and Queer (2SLGBTQ) community and friends.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Promotes the study and practice of choral music and affirms 2SLGBTQ+ community identity and culture by establishing and operating a bilingual gay men's chorus and performing choral concerts for the benefit of the public-at-large.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Ottawa Pride Hockey
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Ottawa's inclusive hockey team, founded and run by queer and trans individuals.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Ottawa Senior Pride Network
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Works to advance change for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, two-spirited, and queer-identified senior adults over 50 years of age in the National Capital Region.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Ottawa Time Out Hiking Club
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: A hiking club for members of the gay, lesbian, bisexual, trans, and queer (LGBTQ+) communities.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Ottawa Trans Library
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Houses a collection of books by trans authors, as well as historical, important, and interesting works on trans issues and people.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Ottawa Wolves Rugby Football Club
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: A Rugby Football Club for men and women. Team members are predominantly part of the LGBTQA community, but diverse in its make-up, and inclusive of everyone.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Out and About Ottawa-Gatineau
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: A free, all-encompassing Meetup group for people that identify as LGBTQ2S+ and their allies who like to go out, be entertained and socialise.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: pflag Canada
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Help 2SLGBTQIA+ individuals and their loved ones connect with resources and find a supportive community.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Positive Spaces Initiative
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Shares resources and increases organizational capacity across the immigrant- and refugee-serving sector to more effectively serve LGBTQIA+ immigrants, refugees, and newcomers.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Pride Capital Volleyball
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Promotes volleyball and the well-being of the 2SLGBTQ+ community of the National Capital Region by offering fun, inclusive, and positive spaces for 2SLGBTQ+ people and allies of all skill levels.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Psychiatric Survivors of Ottawa Rainbow Peers Support Group
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Creates a safe space to share about sexual orientation, gender identity, mental health, and experiences accessing services.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Public Service Pride
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Builds a workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered to contribute fully, ensuring that the federal public service is a model of inclusion and equity.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: qtpoc++ socialbees ottawa-gatineau
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Social networking forum for use by qtpoc++ for building solidarity in the Ottawa-Gatineau area.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Rainbow Health Ontario
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Advances 2SLGBTQ+ health equity in Ontario through provider training, resources, and advocacy.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Rideau Speedeaus
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: An inclusive masters swim club which values swimming in a diverse, fun, open, safe, and supportive environment. Helps members reach their swimming goals, whether they be for recreation, fitness, or competition. Fosters connection and friendship through social and swimming activities.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: SAEFTY Ottawa
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Fosters spaces for trans and gender-diverse children, youth, and adults, along with their families, to connect with each other through youth-centred events outside of mainstream health and social services in the Ottawa region.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Trans Outaouais
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Promotes the development of harmonious relations within the LGBTQIA2S+ community and the inclusion of gender-diverse people and all other intersections.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Tone Cluster
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Creates a queer-positive environment where singers can be themselves and work towards choral excellence, all while supporting those of varied sexual or ientation, gender identity, and relationship orientation, as well as highlighting intersections between the 2SLGBTQIA+ community and other equity-seeking groups.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: UOSU Pride Centre
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: An independent, student-run service that strives to promote and represent a culture of affirmation through the celebration of individual diversity and choice in all areas of life.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Western Ottawa Community Resource Centre Queerios LGBTQ+
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Offers a safe space for connection, growth, and community engagement to LGBTQ+ youth aged 12-17.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: We Are Allies
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Helps adults learn how to support and care for the trans, Two-Spirit, and non-binary youth in their lives.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Wisdom2Action

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: YouthLine
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Offers free support through its Ontario-wide 2SLGBTQ+ peer-support HelpLine.

twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.name: Youth Services Bureau of Ottawa (YSB) Spectrum 2SLGBTQ Community Youth Group
twoSLGBTQIAplus_orgs.description: Provides workshops, discussion groups, art collaborations, counselling services, peer mentoring, and primary care resources.
